page.title: 15THE FIRE STATION, CORSHAM
page.content: There has been a fire station in Corsham for about 100 years.The old fire station was in Priory Street.Today the fire station is in Beechfield Road and it was built in the late 1950s.There are two appliances at the station they are a Bedford and a Dodge,they cost around Â£50,000 new.There are 20 men in Corsham Fire Service when it is fully manned.The station officer is in charge,the sub officer is second in charge and then four leading firemen.Depending on what rank they are they get Â£700 _ Â£900 a year retainig pay. For a turnout they get Â£7 if there are enough men to man the appliance and if they don't get on they get Â£3.For a practice or drill they get Â£5.The firemen are called out on average four times a week.
